Articles.Content:
I tried using this mod. I can place the Pwing parts but after I place them I can't even mouse over. They just stay there, wont turn green when moused over and I can't select them either.

Can someone help please? I really want to use this mod.

Can someone help please? I really want to use this mod.

Are you sure the part has attached to the ship properly? It sounds like the part has just been "set aside" where you can't manipulate it. Pick up the part and place your cursor on a part of the ship itself before clicking, see if that fixes it.

Are you sure the part has attached to the ship properly? It sounds like the part has just been "set aside" where you can't manipulate it. Pick up the part and place your cursor on a part of the ship itself before clicking, see if that fixes it.

Yeah I'v placed it down properly. I click on the part in the menu, I put it down any where, on my ship or not, it is now there for ever. I can reclick it again to move it around, it is just stuck.

Double post.

Edited August 30, 2014 by KombatWumbat

Can you share a screenshot of the part attached to the ship in the SPH?

Also, forgive me if you already knew this, but the wing's shape is changed by holding R, T, or G with the mouse over the part and dragging (no clicking). It's a little tricky to get the hang of at first.

My installation folder.

As you can see below, they are attached properly, I can't click them or move them or delete them any more unless I press CTRL+Z. Once I place it down, it can't be clicked. In the picture I had my mouse over the wings but it doesn't turn green.

That screenshot shows the PWings parts are massively duplicated Ã¢â‚¬â€œ the white streaks are a result of multiple overlapping parts.

It's possible, though unlikely, that the problem is a result of your outdated version of Module Manager: 2.1.5 was built for KSP 0.23.5. Make sure all your mods are the latest versions Ã¢â‚¬â€œ there were even community-driven updates to B9 for 0.24+.

Can you replicate the problem with just PWings in a fresh install of KSP? Please also see the How to Get Support sticky in the Support (modded installs) forum. It will tell you where to find the information you should include in a support request.

Alright, i'll see what I can do.

Thank you.
holysmokes why have I not installed this sooner???
Thank you for this mod!!! I've built a spaceplane, which is capable of enormous hights and more!! The engine is able to work until about 67'000 meters (If you do it correctly)!

Thank you for this mod!!! I've built a spaceplane, which is capable of enormous hights and more!! The engine is able to work until about 67'000 meters (If you do it correctly)!

Psssshhhhhh that's not intake spamming at all! Why don't we have planes like that IRL?

Sarcasm
this thing is awesome, any plans to add tip rotation? unlock the 2nd wing root's scale from 1st wing's tip scale?

I have a few requests I think could improve this plugin.

The first is to make it so the mouse cursor doesn't move when R T or G is depressed. If you force the cursor to stay put while the control keys are down, it would minimize accidentally changing the wing when working on the tail if one appears behind the other. To clarify, the wing size would change, but the cursor wouldn't move... until you let go of the contol key.

The second is NEAR support. I'm just throwing my hat in the pile for that one.

I have a few requests I think could improve this plugin.

The first is to make it so the mouse cursor doesn't move when R T or G is depressed. If you force the cursor to stay put while the control keys are down, it would minimize accidentally changing the wing when working on the tail if one appears behind the other. To clarify, the wing size would change, but the cursor wouldn't move... until you let go of the contol key.

I second this. I'm always screwing up my wings when trying to resize control surfaces. It's not a dealbreaker, but it does get annoying sometimes. Otherwise, this is one of my favorite mods, and I can't do space planes without it.

How do I get all moving pWings to work? is the rigging setup different than standard pWing surface? I used the same modules from AllMovingSurface; by my part doesn't move after Launch.

for the all moving pWing I have ModuleControlSurface; WingManipulator; FARControllaSurface modules. rigging parts are all named matching the sample pWing FBX. I'm missing a proper transform for FARControllableSurface... how do I give the correct transform? MovableSection= or movableSecation = didn't do the trick.

edit: adding another transform obj_ctrlSrf did the trick... but movement is flipped... roll shows pitch movements, pitch shows roll movements. actual control forces are correct though.

Edited September 1, 2014 by nli2work

Psssshhhhhh that's not intake spamming at all! Why don't we have planes like that IRL?

Sarcasm

Wait.... So this mod is not to just spam intakes onto seriously big wings at a leightweight plane which just got one engine??

New to this mod, for some reason it seems as though my CoL is always much farther forward than what the SPH is telling me, when I try to fly my planes with procedural wings they always flip up and over, normal wings no problem.... Thoughts?

New to this mod, for some reason it seems as though my CoL is always much farther forward than what the SPH is telling me, when I try to fly my planes with procedural wings they always flip up and over, normal wings no problem.... Thoughts?

I am having the same problem.

@Mattdogking

You'll need to supply more information in order to get useful support, since most people do not seem to be encountering this issue. Please see my reply to KombatWumbat for how to create a support request.

Hopefully Porkjet can add a procedural wing at some point. I found a post where he said he might do one.

Does anyone know if there's a way to lower the impact that the procedural control surfaces have on CoL? I think it moves it back to much compared to non procedural control surfaces of similar size.

Normal b9 control surfaces

Procedural b9 control surface, moves the CoL farther back despite being smaller
